website_summaries.verdict: A tough chipper and shredder that offers long-running, good power to handle all kinds of yard debris – but it's noisy and dusty.
pros: Mulches leaves fully, and can handle branches up to 3 inches in diameter without much trouble, users report
cons: Very dusty, with air filter needing to be cleaned frequently
Long or crooked branches must be cut down before feeding
Mulch bag is difficult to attach

customer_reviews.title: Fine For Leaves and very small stuff
customer_reviews.text: All in all disappointed in the utility of this unit. Does fine with what you can dump into the top, but in order to feed anything into the branch chute, it has to be trimmed of any/all protrusions, and if the branch is very far off perfectly straight you cannot get it in. A three inch branch that has a hardly noticeable bend will not go through. Maybe something is wrong with my trees, because I don't have many that sprout straight branches. I spent more time lopping branches to get them to feed through than I did chipping. In hind sight I would have spent more on a unit that would gobble up whatever you stuffed into it.
customer_reviews.author: RPM

customer_reviews.title: good luck. Be careful with roots or knots - ...
customer_reviews.text: After one season, I am still impressed with this chipper. It starts on the first pull on a cold engine. Takes a few more pulls when it's warm, which seems backwards to me. It chews up branches and brush with ease. There are a few drawbacks. The top hopper requires either very loose items (like leaves) or for you to only feed long, thin branches. If the branches are tangled, good luck. Be careful with roots or knots - one clogged the machine and it took me almost an hour to dislodge. The machine lives up to its advertising, so I am well pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jon HullTop Contributor: Drums

customer_reviews.title: Great, but no dipstick.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome unit, I would buy it again. I don't like however the very obscure and difficult to fill oil reservoir. And there is no dipstick to check it. UPDATE: After using it several times this summer, one of the plastic wheels cracked and it very quickly came off. Replaced the wheels with these parts....
customer_reviews.author: sHoCkErRoCkEt

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until it started falling apart. We have about 30 oak trees. The first year we used it, it was great. Then pieces just started breaking and falling off. the exhaust pipe just broke in half and the muffler fell off, etc. Still works well mulching but don't get close to the open exhaust pipe.
customer_reviews.author: rtkess

customer_reviews.title: If you ask me, I'd say its a toy
customer_reviews.text: It vibrates a lot. The feeder is rather finicky and required constant attention. Its an expensive little toy my husband thought he could not leave without, last summer. THIS summer, he hasn't used it once. He says it is too hard to sit there by the chipper, the noise, the feeding of brunches, the constant cutting and work to cut everything to fit the feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Irit

customer_reviews.title: Probably ok for very small jobs
customer_reviews.text: This is not strong enough for lager tree limbs I guess if you look at the way it works it makes sense. If you have a branches from a tree you have to do a lot of pruning and trimming to fit the branches into the small opening.
customer_reviews.author: John Kemp

customer_reviews.title: Tried the branch part and like other reviews it must be trimmed to fit
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews for this product and thought i should contribute. I didn't have any problem starting it although it does take muscle power. Had to choke it for one pull every time I started it and took several pulls some times. Make sure gas is turned on and throttle is on fast. it's a small chipper shredder and must be feed slowly so as not to clog it, if you are in a hurry you need a bigger one. Tried the branch part and like other reviews it must be trimmed to fit. for the price I liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Sawdust

customer_reviews.title: Could be the best chipper/shredder that I have owned!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few different chippers/shredders over the years. This could be the best one for residential use that I have owned. After unpacking and filling with oil and gas, the engine started on the first pull! I am very happy with the finished product (mulch), but the hopper is a little small so you have to feed your brush, small branches, and leaves slowly. Also, I wish there was a better attachment mechanism for the bag; it sometimes comes off during shredding. Otherwise, I really like this machine so far.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Cartun

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy Earthquake!
customer_reviews.text: This chipper is garbage. Total engineering flop. The vibration is such that all screws and bolts come loose. It vibrates so violently that the exhaust manifold broke. I replaced the exhaust two times. I had to replace broken parts after every use. After one year of using this, It now is broken beyond repair. It's is headed to the scrap yard.
customer_reviews.author: Damon M Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: A reliable hard working machine
customer_reviews.text: I have spent two weeks working with the new Chipper and am very happy with the results. The machine met my expectations by reducing a 5000 cu.ft. pile of brush to a manageable and useful pile of mulch. It is easy to start and fairly easy to use. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Broken Kickstand
customer_reviews.text: Well...it works well chipping and shredding. However, the oil fill access is poorly designed, it's a bit difficult to start, the gas cap leaks, and the throttle will not stay on full. Then the kickstand broke! It's obvious the kickstand had metal fatigue and was fractured almost all the way through during manufacture (see picture) Also, having only one leg for a stand support seems insufficient. These issues should be corrected in future models.
customer_reviews.author: Mecky

customer_reviews.title: would like to see a more user friendly oil check and ...
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the unit........however, would like to see a more user friendly oil check and oil fill hole location. Had to fashion a flexible hose to use on a funnel to fill it. The pull start is easy to use but it would be nice to have something to put your foot on that would hold it more solid. These are small things that I would change; the unit is well made and works as it is advertised!! That is most welcome in this day and age!! Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great chipper for all your yard debris
customer_reviews.text: This thing kicks butt. It chips and shreds everything I put into it. Delivery and packaging were great. Easy to assemble. I was chipping field brush in less than an hour after assembling it and read the safety precautions.
customer_reviews.author: RV Maximum

customer_reviews.title: Very good chipper shredder
customer_reviews.text: The starter coil is somewhat hard to pull, but otherwise this is a fantastic shredder. It's eaten through everything I've thrown at it without any difficulties.
customer_reviews.author: Truman Brown

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Home-owners chipper/shredder
customer_reviews.text: Very nice machine. Only complaint I have is the packaging. When delivered it had a broken wheel. The manufacturer was quick to replace the wheel, but it was not necessary. Back to the product, It's a tree limb hog!! I have been crunching mostly white pine. If it fits in the chute it chews it up. Also does well with the hard woods I've put through. Not much, but enough to know it's tough enough to handle. One problem is the velocity that the chips and shreds are spit out. You really need to use the bag! If you want to make a mulch pile, it's a bit messy but it does the job. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Steve R.

customer_reviews.title: I have had the chipper shredder for approximately 6 months ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had the chipper shredder for approximately 6 months. I have been trying to get warranty service because the blade is jammed and the machine will no longer start. The service company I was sent to by Earthquake is giving me a run around. E.g., they won't pick it up, but aren't in the service shop during normal working hours - so I was instructed to leave it outside the shop (and trust that it will still be there when they get there). I was also told it would take at least a month to fix it. Not the kind of service I expect at this price.
customer_reviews.author: mgberg

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment!
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what I needed, will chip up to a 3 inch log no problem, just don't overfill the throat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It does what I need it to do. Cons: 1. Bag is difficult to attach correctly w/out it coming off. 2. Wheel broke after less that 6 uses in 5 months. I'm not wheeling it over rough terrain, just across my lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This thing does the job. Great price. Would like a bigger bag even though it would be heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Zip

customer_reviews.title: good chipper shredder.
customer_reviews.text: Works quite well. Grinds branches easily, up to 2." Haven't had it long enough to say more.
customer_reviews.author: Dave P.

customer_reviews.title: Good for yard maintenance
customer_reviews.text: This chipper works quite well around our yard, chipping and shredding small brush, branches and leaves.
customer_reviews.author: LollyTop Contributor: Knitting

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all-around chipper
customer_reviews.text: Excellent all-around chipper. Logs and branches of exceptionally hard wood have a tendency to jam in the chipper but this is easily rectified. Wonderful for mulching leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Clonick

customer_reviews.title: Earthquake 9060300 Chipper Shredder with 205cc 4-Cycle Briggs and Stratton...
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this item. He has used it 4 times since we purchased it, and he raves about it every time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: Hews up branches and leaves really good and the mulch comes out pretty fine
customer_reviews.text: Started up first pull and even after sitting 2 or 3 weeks a couple times it still started on the second pull. Hews up branches and leaves really good and the mulch comes out pretty fine. Only thin that is a bit hard as I have read in other reviews is that the oil is a little difficult to fill. Other than that I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Much more chipper for the money! Handles brush and branches as promised without fail. Great value for the money. Arrived ready to go, on time. Just needed to fill the oil and gas. Also, it’s good on gas!
customer_reviews.author: Lesley MacLean

customer_reviews.title: Best price for my use and more appropriate for small usage
customer_reviews.text: Great machine exception of attachment of the bag are not very friendly, the solution I use a bungee cord to tight over the bag to the nut for safety and secure and prevent the bag opening during the work. This is more powerful than I was expected the day I bought it! For anyone having trees on their land and who want to do it compost this is a must! the size of the residue are exactly the right size for fast composting base, using the compost over your fruit trees or garden to protect against hot day and adding powerful push on growth your plants.
customer_reviews.author: popoki_tm

customer_reviews.title: CHEWS IT ALL UP!
customer_reviews.text: This is based off first use. Half straw bail as is, weigela, roses,tomatoe vines all cut to 10'' to 12'' pieces,12' sunflower, 12' stink trees, 12' maples 2'' to 3'' trunks. This machine turned all these items into shavings comparable to a planer and smaller. Dry leaves ran threw resembled coffee grounds. 5 stars for performance. 4 stars for plastic parts and exhaust shoot not designed well. Feed materials with slower too moderate pace and this machine works very well. This is not an industrial chipper good for small, medium, and larger properties lightly wooded. Composters and mushroom growers will love finished product if you don't try to do to much at once.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Cheap wheels and faulty leg stand
customer_reviews.text: Used it today for half an hour .On the way back to the shed the wheel broke and fell off. I'll have to go to hardware store and buy metal rim wheels to replace the plastic ones it comes with . Rather disappointed in this item. Today 6/04/2020 the leg stand broke where it was bent from the engine. I would not recommend purchasing this item.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Stineman

customer_reviews.title: Great homeowner tool
customer_reviews.text: Great homeowner tool. Handles anything it says it will. I have been useing mine to shread many branches as well as rotten alfalfa bails for mulch. works well. The only draw backs: two bolts protrude into the leave/grass feed shoot causing hang ups. and both shoots are so safe as to be a hindrance. The mulch collecting bag connection is poorly designed and can be time consuming and frusterating. Very happy with the tool over all.
customer_reviews.author: Nels Olson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and if you jam it up, easy to take apart to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Brotherton

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with the shoot load. Doesn't work very good at all. You can put things in the top & that works fine, but make sure to wear gloves... it will take it away from you if your not careful. Honestly, I wish I had not gotten it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Cher Barrett

customer_reviews.title: One of my best purchases.
customer_reviews.text: One of my best purchases .. easy to unpack and with no problems .. only drawback is pulling on starter string as unit tips easily if not held firmly in place by someone else .. however, do NOT let this discourage you from purchasing this unit!
customer_reviews.author: loulouKap

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad little machine
customer_reviews.text: My first experience right out of the box was not so good. However, that said, this little machine does a fine job on dry vegetation and moist limbs. It's not so great when the material is the other way around. While not quite the workhorse I would personally like, it's a good little machine. BTW -- The motor is a Viper, not a Briggs and Stratton.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi Luttrell

customer_reviews.title: we really like the product
customer_reviews.text: we really like the product. my husband requested a monthly bill be sent to us . he was wondering when we should exspect the firist monthly payment to start . havent heard anything as of yet . please advise us in a email thank you
customer_reviews.author: linda s. perry

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: works well except when the weather is cold. Won't start
customer_reviews.author: Fay Mohl

customer_reviews.title: Turns branches into mulch with ease
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the unit so far. My wife and I used it to clear some land we have containing smaller trees. It chews up any branches/leaves, etc. that you can fit into the chute with ease. It turns the trimmings into a use able mulch which we are using to cover some unattractive land. Make sure to use hearing protection as the unit is extremely loud. We are very pleased with the purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: VolbeatYou

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT FOR LEAF VACUUM PURPOSES!!!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this unit for leaf vacuum activities. As a chipper/shreader it's reputation is sterling. My experience with leaf collection/vacuum has been it lacks the needed suction to effectively collect light to heavy leaf cover.
customer_reviews.author: Hepotter

customer_reviews.title: received two damaged ones
customer_reviews.text: I had to order this product twice. Both times it came in damaged. the second time was worst than the first one. Other customer had the same problem. I should have been a where.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

product_meta.title: Earthquake 9060300 Chipper Shredder with 205cc 4-Cycle Briggs & Stratton Engine, 5 Year Warranty
product_meta.description: With our patented dual triangular hammer design, Earthquake chipper-shredders offer maximum power at the point of impact. Triangulating the force actually increases shredding and chipping power, making our chipper-shredder quick and efficient. With a metal cone and high-powered Briggs and Stratton Engine, you'll have the durability and shredding strength to turn yard waste into the perfect mulch.
feature_bullets: Chips materials up to 3 Inch in diameter
Converts brush piles into usable mulch

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars81 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
